title: New Beginnings
summary: Our very first broadcast.

title: Small Scale Sin
summary: Three teenage boys tell us about their forays into low-level credit card hacking.

title: Poultry Slam 1995
summary: Decrying the wonders of turkeys, chickens, and other fowl.

title: Vacations
summary: Vacations gone awry—or perhaps vacations that never should have happened.

title: Anger and Forgiveness
summary: Stories that reveal the societal "trend" toward anger and away from genuine forgiveness.

title: Christmas
summary: A Christmas radio play by David Sedaris.

title: Quitting
summary: People who quit everything in their lives that they hated.

title: New Year
summary: Reflecting back on 1995.

title: Julia Sweeney
summary: Julia Sweeney and her brother found out they each had cancer six months apart.

title: Double Lives
summary: People living their lives, just like the rest of us. Plus an extra life.

title: Enemies
summary: A friendship between two young boys that was destroyed through the manipulative acts of one of them.

title: Animals
summary: The animalness of animals, and the irreducible ways in which they are not human.

title: Love
summary: The dream of true love and the difficulties with achieving and maintaining that dream.

title: Accidental Documentaries
summary: Stories made from old recordings found in attics and thrift stores.

title: Dawn
summary: Jack Hitt stumbles onto an epic story of the Old South and changing cultural norms in America.

title: Economy
summary: Politics, the economy, and the big picture.

title: Name Change / No Theme
summary: Our first show as This American Life.

title: Liars
summary: A girl who adored her father tries to figure out what to think after he takes some of her college money and lies to her about it.

title: Rich Guys
summary: Men who had comfortable, decent lives, yet decided to do something wild and eccentric.

title: From A Distance
summary: Stories of admiring someone from afar, and trying to get closer to them.

title: Factions
summary: Friends get together to start a business, start a church, do political action together. And after a while, they start fighting and split up.

title: Adult Children
summary: Stories of the difficult relationships between parents and their grown children.

title: Drama Bug
summary: Stories of the people who fall for a life in the theater.

title: Teenaged Girls
summary: Girls who have to figure out how they're going to act when the ground rules are constantly shifting.

title: Basketball
summary: The Chicago Bulls and their grip on Chicagoans' hearts and lives during the NBA playoffs.

title: Father's Day '96
summary: Ira's own father, Barry Glass, co-hosts this special Father's Day show.

title: The Cruelty of Children
summary: A story of youthful backstabbing by David Sedaris.

title: Detectives
summary: David Sedaris recalls the days when his mother and sister played armchair detective.

title: Bob Dole
summary: Unusual perspectives on the presumptive Republican nominee.

title: Obsession
summary: What happens when a little idea starts to control you.

title: When You Talk About Music
summary: Stories of people whose lives are transformed by music.

title: Republican Convention
summary: Unusual stories about day-to-day life at the Republican Convention.

title: A Night at the Wiener Circle
summary: Ira Glass spends a night at one of the most boisterous hot dog stands in the nation: Chicago's Wiener Circle.

title: Democratic Convention
summary: Unusual stories from the 1996 Democratic Convention in Chicago.

title: Fall Clearance Sale
summary: Stories that haven't fit into any of our regular "theme" shows.

title: Letters
summary: We took out advertisements in Chicago inviting people to share letters they've received, sent, or found.

title: The Job That Takes Over Your Life
summary: Scott Carrier got a job interviewing schizophrenics. After awhile, he began to wonder if he was a schizophrenic himself.

title: Simulated Worlds
summary: Civil War reenactments, wax museums, simulated coal mines, fake ethnic restaurants, an ersatz Medieval castle, and other re-created worlds that thrive all across America.

title: Halloween
summary: Stories of things that are supposed to be scary, but aren't.

title: Lessons
summary: Spalding Gray on finding the zen of skiing.

title: Politics
summary: Stories of the election you can't hear anywhere else.

title: Get Over It!
summary: Trying to forget the past and move on.

title: Faustian Bargains
summary: People who made a deal with the devil.

title: Poultry Slam 1996
summary: Stories about turkeys, chickens, ducks, and fowl of all kinds.

title: Media Fringe
summary: People struggling at the fringes of our nation's infotainment industry.

title: Sissies
summary: A family where the father was one kind of sissy and the son was another kind, and how the family was destroyed despite the fact that no one wanted it to be.

title: Christmas and Commerce
summary: The intersection of Christmas and retail, including David Sedaris's "Santaland Diaries."

title: Justice
summary: A portrait of Americans at the International Tribunal.

title: Animals
summary: Stories about the animalness of animals, the irreducible ways in which they are not human.

title: Shoulda Been Dead
summary: A man decides to live as if he'll die in six months. That, and other stories of starting life over.

title: Animals Die, People Ponder
summary: Stories of people who handle dead animals. (Don't worry—it's not as gross as it sounds.) Featuring a story by George Saunders.

title: Edge of Sanity
summary: Stories about the border between mental health and mental illness.

title: Valentine’s Day ‘97
summary: Stories about our parents falling in love.

title: Sinatra
summary: Stories, tributes, and attempts to understand the Chairman of the Board.

title: Three Women and the Sex Industry
summary: Radio producer Sandy Tolan was supposed to do a documentary about strippers with an aspiring writer—and stripper—named Susan. But then Susan disappeared.

title: Name Change
summary: Name changes are particularly American stories: they're the dream of starting over with a clean slate.

title: Delivery
summary: Stories about the delivery business and the people in it: UPS men, bike messengers, FedEx dispatchers.

title: Small Towns
summary: The claustrophobia, freedom, and yearning people feel in small towns.

title: Fire
summary: Stories about people who are not afraid of fire, though perhaps they should be.

title: Business of Death
summary: Stories of people for whom death is a job—undertakers, homicide detectives, slaughterhouse workers, and others.

title: Fiasco! (1997)
summary: Stories of when things go wrong. Really wrong.

title: Something for Nothing
summary: Twenty-four people put one hand on a Hardbody pickup truck and wait...until only one person is left standing. Plus other stories of people trying to get rich quick.

title: One Thing
summary: A man tries to run for President as a utopian nudist, and other stories of people whose lives are organized around one thing.

title: Summer
summary: We want summer to be this wonderful break, but so often it fails to deliver.

title: Who's Canadian?
summary: Canadians claim they're no different from red-blooded Americans. We put their position to the test.

title: Tales from the Net
summary: Listeners sent us samples of what they're finding on the internet, including postings from Usenet groups, favorite web pages, and their own email.

title: Your Dream, My Nightmare
summary: An interracial couple takes a plantation tour. And other stories in which someone's dream is someone else's nightmare.

title: Lincoln's Second Inaugural
summary: We look at the legacy of the most moving, poetic inaugural speech in American history.

title: Dream House
summary: Parents moving the family to some new place, hoping it works out for the kids.

title: Other People's Mail
summary: Four stories of people who read other people's mail, and what happens to them once they get caught up in these other lives.

title: Defying Sickness
summary: A man goes on a last big trip with his father who has Alzheimer's.

title: Trek
summary: The story of two Americans—one white, one black—who go to South Africa and have very different opinions about what they find.

title: Blame It on Art
summary: Mona LisaThe darker side of the art world: petty jealousies, competitiveness, failure.

title: Conventions
summary: What happens when people with a common interest gather in fluorescent-lit halls? Sometimes they drive each other crazy, sometimes they fall in love.

title: Kindness of Strangers
summary: A locksmith tells the story of an act of kindness he committed, hoping for a small reward. That, and other stories of kindness in New York City.

title: Mob
summary: The mob as portrayed in movies, and as it is in real life. And its hold over us.

title: Pray
summary: Can the secular world and the religious world understand each other?

title: How Bad Is Bad?
summary: Ira Glass talks to three teenage boys who buy computer equipment using stolen credit card numbers. And other stories.

title: Stuck in the Wrong Decade
summary: People stuck in the wrong decade, or simply carrying a lot of the props from another decade.

title: Running After Antelope
summary: Scott Carrier with the latest installment in his 12-year quest to chase down and catch an antelope.

title: Guns
summary: Americans who love their guns, and the Americans who love them.

title: Haunted
summary: Stories of people who are haunted, not by ghosts or phantoms, but by other people.

title: One of Us
summary: Stories of outsiders who want to be insiders, and vice versa.

title: Harold
summary: The story of Harold Washington and the white backlash that was set off when he became Chicago's first black mayor.

title: Poultry Slam 1997
summary: Chickens and turkeys are a mirror of ourselves.

title: How to Take Money from Strangers
summary: A con man who's so good he's thanked.

title: A Very Special Sedaris Christmas
summary: Holiday stories from David Sedaris and Julia Sweeney.

title: Numbers
summary: People trying to use numbers to describe things that should not be quantified.

title: Sibling Rivalry
summary: Stories about people who are destined to fight: brothers and sisters.

title: Telephone
summary: The story of a teenager, illegal drug use, lying, stealing, and a kid's life changed completely when he heard how he sounded on the phone.

title: Escape the Box
summary: Stories of people trying to escape the box of their own lives, and create new lives.

title: Leave the Mask On
summary: When someone tries to tell you a little bit more about themselves than you'd really rather know.

title: Valentine’s Day ’98
summary: Stories about couples that all take place decades after that moment their eyes first meet.

title: How To
summary: Ira teaches Sarah Vowell how to drive with some advice from the hosts of Car Talk.

title: Monogamy
summary: Stories of people struggling to redefine monogamy, to stay monogamous, and what we should make of these ad hoc experiments in everyday life.

title: Pinned by History
summary: Stories of people who were lifted out of everyday life, thrown into much bigger events, and how that made sense of what they did years after the fact.

title: Death to Wacky
summary: David Sedaris tells true stories of photographers who try to take pictures of him which will make him seem "wacky." That, and other stories of wackiness.

title: Throwing the First Punch
summary: Stories about what it means to be a person who throws the first punch, and how hard it is to give up.

title: I Enjoy Being A Girl, Sort Of
summary: Variations on what it means to be a girl and what it means to be a woman.

title: Radio
summary: A radio show about what makes radio so great, and what makes it so terrible.

title: Niagara
summary: The story of a town that started with something huge—the falls—and built nothing lasting from it.

title: Road Trip!
summary: With so many songs, movies, and books about the joy of the open road, it's hard to take just a normal road trip without huge expectations.

title: Scenes from A Transplant
summary: An NPR reporter leaves her three-year-old son and heads to Omaha—for cancer treatment, and a last chance to save her life.

title: Music Lessons
summary: David Sedaris and Sarah Vowell on what's frustrating about music lessons, what's miraculous about them, and what they actually teach us.

title: Take A Negro Home
summary: Two stories of people who try to cross the color line, and why it's still so hard.

title: Father’s Day ‘98
summary: Stories in which fathers and their kids sit down and try to have an honest moment together.

title: Trail of Tears (1998)
summary: Sarah Vowell re-traces the route her Cherokee ancestors took when expelled from their own land by President Andrew Jackson.

title: Truth and Lies at Age Ten
summary: A woman who'd been diagnosed with cystic fibrosis talks about the lies she told herself as a child.

title: Notes on Camp
summary: We attempt to bridge the gap of misunderstanding between camp people and non-camp people.

title: Mapping
summary: The world redrawn by the five senses.

title: Adventures in the Simple Life
summary: I thought this was supposed to be easy.

title: Ladies and Germs
summary: How irrational fear of germs means that you aren't going to get good apple cider in your local supermarket this fall.

title: Windfall
summary: What happens when you suddenly strike it rich?

title: Last Words
summary: Stories of people's last words before death.

title: First Day
summary: A rookie cop and a squirrel, and other stories of first days on the job.

title: Poultry Slam 1998
summary: Our annual program about turkeys, chickens, and fowl of all types.

title: You Gonna Eat That?
summary: The family table is stage on which many family dramas are played out.

title: What You Lookin’ At?
summary: Stories about seeing and being seen, taped before a live audience in Town Hall in New York City.

title: Lockup
summary: Stories of the lives of prisoners in the United States, and the lives of their families.

title: Be Careful Who You Pretend to Be
summary: Three stories of people pretending to be something they're not, and what happens to them.

title: Twentieth Century Man
summary: What happens if you're too good at throwing everything out and starting over?

title: Valentine’s Day ’99
summary: Stories of impossible love and heartbreak.

title: High Cost of Living
summary: Stories of people who choose not to live every moment to the fullest or smell the roses.

title: Welcome to America
summary: Stories of people moving to this country: what they see and hear that those of us who were born here don't.

title: Apocalypse
summary: Fundamentalist Christians and Orthodox Jews are combining forces to breed a perfect red cow that could bring about the end of the world.

title: Do-Gooders
summary: Two do-gooders try to change things in their hometown for the better. But the more they try, the more people resent them.

title: Pimp Anthropology
summary: A former pimp tells how he and three childhood friends became pimps in the 1970s in Oakland, California.

title: Four Corners
summary: We try to tell the story of life in America through portraits of life in four different states across the nation.

title: Advice
summary: What if you asked people for advice and actually took ALL of the advice that everyone gave you? Sarah Vowell tried exactly that.

title: Away From Home
summary: Stories of people going home to places they've never been before.

title: The Kids Are Alright
summary: Stories in which young people take matters into their own hands, broadcast for the tenth anniversary of the crackdown at Tiananmen Square.

title: Father’s Day ‘99
summary: Photographer Joel Meyerowitz goes on a last big trip with his father, who has Alzheimer's, and his son.

title: Sales
summary: We accompany a Hollywood screenwriter as he tries to sell a movie idea and find ourselves asking, is the art of commerce better than the art of art?

title: We Didn’t
summary: It turns out that not falling in love, not doing our jobs, not spending time with our families is every bit as vivid and complicated an experience as doing something.

title: Allure of Crime
summary: Through our crimes, we express who we are.

title: You Are Here
summary: Three stories, three people, and three sets of maps.

title: The Book That Changed Your Life
summary: We want to believe our lives can be changed by a set of ideas contained in a book.

title: The Real Thing
summary: Stories of people drawn to some idea, some picture, some "thing" that they just want to be.

title: Ghosts of Elections Past
summary: Stories designed to provide some small sense of hope about American politics.

title: Family Business
summary: What happens when the tension of family dynamics collides with the pressure of capitalist market forces.

title: Invisible Worlds
summary: Stories of people who are trying to make invisible worlds visible.

title: Barbara
summary: We hear the story of one African-American single mother who recorded her family's life over the course of seven months.

title: Sentencing
summary: Have mandatory minimum sentences gone too far?

title: Where Words Fail
summary: People struggle to invent words adequate to cope with death.

title: Poultry Slam 1999
summary: Our annual program about turkeys, chickens, fowl of all types, and their mysterious hold over our imaginations.

title: Urban Nature
summary: David Rakoff visits Iceland, where the government is careful not to disturb certain boulders because some people believe that elves live there.

title: A Teenager's Guide to God
summary: Oh faithless and perverse generation? How long shall I be with you? How long shall I bear with you?—Matthew 17.

title: The Angels Wanna Wear My Red Suit
summary: The many, many different versions of Santa Claus.

title: Bedside Diplomacy
summary: In the hospital, we're in a place that has its own rules and its own language and its own customs.

title: Kids As Adults
summary: Stories of kids trying to act like adults—some by choice—some because they're forced to.

title: Primary
summary: Stories from the New Hampshire primary. We hear from voters who've found candidates they love. And we hear what those voters are seeing that the rest of us aren't.

title: Crush
summary: What if you held onto a high-school crush? Under what conditions would it never go away? Tobias Wolff reads a short story called "Kiss."

title: Dolls
summary: The story of the book The Lonely Doll and its author, and how the author's life came to resemble something from her book.

title: In Dog We Trust (2000)
summary: Exactly how much are the animals that live in our home caught up in everyday family dynamics?

title: Hoaxing Yourself (2000)
summary: Stories of people who tell a lie and then believe the lie more than anyone else does.

title: What Remains
summary: Stories of people revisiting what happened, and who they were back when.

title: Secret Life of Daytime
summary: All those people you see in the middle of the workday, in coffee shops and bookstores—why aren't they at work?

title: Mob Mentality
summary: The pleasure and the terror of being in a rampaging, angry mob.

title: Mother’s Day
summary: Stories of moms: How they treat us, how we treat them.

title: Character Assassination
summary: David Foster Wallace reports on a turning point in the 2000 presidential primary.

title: Million Bubbles
summary: A look at what's going on inside the individual glass and steel worlds of our cars.

title: Moving
summary: Stories of people who did not want to move but circumstance forced their hands.

title: Can You Fight City Hall…If You Are City Hall?
summary: Stories of people who stand up alone for what's right, damn the consequences.

title: Crime Scene (2000)
summary: Crime scenes and the stories they tell.

title: Americans in Paris
summary: David Sedaris takes Ira on a tour of his favorite spots in Paris.

title: Nobody's Family Is Going to Change
summary: Does anyone's family ever change?

title: Memo to the People of the Future
summary: Stories of people who are trying to control how they'll be seen by generations to come.

title: The Fix Is In
summary: We go inside the back rooms of one multinational corporation and hear the intricate workings of how they put the fix in.

title: Pursuit of Happiness
summary: What does it mean to grow up in a country with an inalienable right to pursue happiness?

title: Immigration
summary: We look at a 1996 immigration law that is too obscure for most of us to have heard of, but which affects tens of thousands of lives in huge ways.

title: Election
summary: Stories for the eve of the 2000 presidential election, in which we try to look beneath the candidates' soundbites.

title: 24 Hours at the Golden Apple
summary: One day in a Chicago diner.

title: Three Kinds of Deception
summary: A story of self-deception, a story about deceiving others, and a story about accidental deception.

title: Birthdays, Anniversaries, and Milestones
summary: A live show taped for our fifth anniversary.

title: Babysitting
summary: A brother and sister decide to invent children to babysit, as an excuse to get out of their own house.

title: Two Nations, One President
summary: Democrats explain why they're having trouble getting over the 2001 election, and Republicans explain why this is so infuriating.

title: American Limbo
summary: Stories of people living completely outside the grid of American life.

title: Superpowers
summary: Which is better: flight or invisibility?

title: Cicero
summary: The story of what was, at one time, one of most notoriously racist and corrupt suburbs in America.

title: Return to Childhood 2001
summary: Alex Blumberg tries to find a woman who babysat him when he was nine, and other stories of people trying to revisit their childhoods.

title: The Friendly Man
summary: Stories from Scott Carrier, whose strange and compelling tales sound like nothing else on the radio.

title: Cringe
summary: Tales of personal humiliation, romance gone wrong, and people who profoundly misjudge how they're perceived by others.

title: The Missing Parents Bureau
summary: Women planning to get pregnant with the help of a sperm bank tell us about the questions they wrestle with of how much they want to know about the fathers of their kids.

title: Neighbors
summary: An average Chicagoan decides to appeal the disputes and problems in his neighborhood to a higher authority, Mr. Rogers. Yes, that Mr. Rogers.

title: Golden Calf
summary: Stories of people worshiping false idols, and whether that's always a bad thing.

title: Prom
summary: While the seniors danced at Prom Night 2001 in Hoisington, Kansas—a town of about 3,000—a tornado hit the town.

title: Father's Day '01
summary: Stories of dads who are utterly human in scale.

title: Kid Logic (2001)
summary: Stories of kids using perfectly logical arguments, and arriving at perfectly wrong conclusions.

title: Hitler’s Yacht
summary: A modern-day fable about what happens when the free market, the media, the World War II buffs, the Neo-Nazis, and the Jews all collide over a huge Nazi tourist trap.

title: Living the Dream
summary: There's a deep impulse in American culture that says that you can make yourself into anyone.

title: I Know What You Did This Summer
summary: Scott Carrier travels cross-country without air conditioning, during weather in which it's too hot to stay in the car and too hot to get out.

title: Meet the Pros
summary: The story of one man's journey from obscurity to international professional celebrity.

title: Stories of Loss
summary: A collection of stories in which people try to make sense of loss.

title: Before and After
summary: Stories in the wake of the events of September 11, 2001.

title: War Stories
summary: We try to sort out what the war in Afghanistan will be like.

title: Rashomon
summary: The events of September 11th, and how its meaning changes depending on who you talk to.

title: Before It Had A Name
summary: In 1946, a man started to investigate the Holocaust before it was known as the Holocaust, gathering the first recorded testimonials of concentration camp survivors.

title: How to Win Friends and Influence People
summary: People climbing to be number one. How do they do it?

title: House on Loon Lake
summary: A young boy, an abandoned house, and the mysterious family who disappeared without a trace.

title: Hearts and Minds
summary: Of all the wars to win, perhaps the propaganda war is the hardest.

title: Them
summary: In a time of war, when we're all feeling a heightened sense of "us" and "them," we wanted to take up the problem of "them."

title: Faith
summary: Stories of faith: losing it, talking about it, constructing it, and working within it.

title: Recordings for Someone
summary: Personal recordings one person made for just one other person.

title: 81 Words
summary: How the American Psychiatric Association decided that homosexuality was no longer a mental illness.

title: Plan B
summary: There's the thing you plan to do, and then there's the thing you end up doing.

title: Somewhere in the Arabian Sea
summary: Life aboard an aircraft carrier stationed in the Arabian Sea supporting bombing missions over Afghanistan.

title: Special Ed
summary: Stories about people who were told that they're different.

title: Office Politics
summary: Stories of high drama from our nation's workplaces.

title: Didn’t Ask to Be Born
summary: The story of an eighth grader who set himself on fire, and what led to that.

title: Perfect Evidence
summary: DNA evidence isn't just proving wrongdoing by criminals, it's proving wrongdoing by police and prosecutors.

title: Naming Names
summary: When you turn someone over to the authorities, it can set into motion lots of huge, unintended consequences.

title: The Other Man
summary: Stories about what happens when a new guy comes on the scene and changes everything.

title: Devil on My Shoulder
summary: Stories of people who try to convince you that the devil is there, whispering in your ear.

title: Family Physics
summary: We take the laws of physics and apply them to the realm of human relationships.

title: Ask An Expert
summary: Stories about people who turned to the experts and got horrible advice.

title: Give the People What They Want
summary: Ira Glass goes to a fake wedding at a home for Alzheimer's patients.

title: Give It to Them
summary: Two years after the Mideast peace process collapsed, we wanted to understand what that has done to people living in Israel and the West Bank.

title: Act V
summary: A group of inmates at a high-security prison stage a production of the last act of Hamlet.

title: High Speed Chase
summary: What happened after a group of Native American girls from one town found themselves being chased down the highway by a group of white boys from another town.

title: Testosterone
summary: The pros and cons of the hormone of desire.

title: Fake I.D.
summary: Stories of people traveling under false identities, not for power or personal gain, but for their own deeper personal reasons.

title: Suckers
summary: Some people have a rather dark worldview that divides people into two groups: Suckers and non-suckers.

title: Classifieds
summary: We take the classifieds from one Sunday edition of the paper and fill a program with stories that come from the ads.

title: Middlemen
summary: "Hi, middleman. Here are three splendid acts to toast your subtle virtues."

title: Home Movies
summary: Home movies are often all the same—kids on the beach, people getting married, birthday parties—so why do we make and watch so many of them?

title: Reruns
summary: Stories of people stuck in moments that they revisit over and over again.

title: Why We Fight
summary: We still have some basic questions about why we're going to war and whether it's a good thing.

title: You Are So Beautiful…To Me
summary: Two modern-day reinterpretations of the Frog Prince story.

title: Secret Government
summary: Stories of some of the secrets our government keeps: of imprisonment, deportation, and spying.

title: Come Back to Afghanistan
summary: A California teenager returns to the home country he's never known.

title: Time to Save the World
summary: Stories of sudden truths delivered by complete strangers.

title: The Real Story
summary: Real stories from three very different wars.

title: Starting From Scratch
summary: A man in retirement tries to start over in a new life with a new venture: a cable channel, with lots of puppies.

title: Say Anything
summary: Does talking about it really help?

title: The Balloon Goes Up
summary: Stories from the beginnings of the war in Iraq, and how it compares with wars in our country's past.

title: My Two Cents
summary: We try to figure out the paradox of the current economy, where Americans are simultaneously both losing jobs and buying new homes and cars.

title: Regime Change
summary: Stories of regime change in everyday life.

title: Lost in Translation
summary: Jonathan Goldstein and Starlee Kine go to a karaoke club that has, along with all the songs, comedy routines for people to perform.

title: Lost in America
summary: Stories of people who are lost, histories that are lost, and things that are lost.

title: I’m In Charge Now
summary: There is a ominous information gap between the U.S. officials running the country and the Iraqi people being governed.

title: 20 Acts in 60 Minutes
summary: All kinds of little stories that we ordinarily can't use on the radio show because they are just too short.

title: Enemy Camp
summary: The story of a fixer for the Catholic Church and how he came to sympathize with the people that he was sent to deceive.

title: Later That Same Day
summary: Stories about what the passage of time can do to someone.

title: MacGyver
summary: Four real stories in which real people invent amazingly clever solutions to their problems.

title: Allure of the Mean Friend
summary: They treat us poorly, they don't call us back, they cancel plans at the last minute, and yet we keep coming back for more.

title: My Pen Pal
summary: Stories of very unusual pen pals, people whose relationship could not exist without the help of the postal service.

title: What Is This Thing?
summary: What is this thing called love? For answers, we explore the romance novel industry, a $1.5 billion empire run almost entirely by and for women.

title: Like It or Not
summary: David Rakoff guest hosts.

title: Garbage
summary: We follow the trash from the sanitation men on the street, to the mob guys who controlled the hauling business, to the people who actually live in dumps.

title: The Annoying Gap Between Theory...and Practice
summary: Why is it always harder than you think it'll be?

title: Brother’s Keeper
summary: In his ongoing effort to write his own version of the Bible, Jonathan Goldstein retells the story of Cain and Abel.

title: Poultry Slam 2003
summary: Turkeys, chickens, geese, ducks, fowl of all kinds, real and imagined, and their mysterious hold over us.

title: The Middle of Nowhere
summary: The tiny island of Nauru is at the center of several of the decade's biggest global events.

title: Teenage Embed, Part Two
summary: Hyder returns to Afghanistan.

title: Our Holiday Gift-Giving Guide
summary: The vexing difficulty of finding the perfect gift.

title: Living Without (2004)
summary: Sarah Vowell explains the cheerful journalism of deprivation. And other stories.

title: What I Should’ve Said
summary: People return to the scene of the crime where they should have spoken clearly and forcefully to review what the hell went wrong.

title: Leaving the Fold (2004)
summary: People leaving the situation they're used to and striking off for something less familiar.

title: Promised Land
summary: David Rakoff tries a 20-day fast to see if it will bring him any form of enlightenment.

title: The Facts Don’t Matter
summary: How a bungled Nazi sabotage operation became the legal foundation for the Bush administration's push to try U.S. citizens in military tribunals.

title: The Sanctity of Marriage
summary: A generation of researchers has revolutionized the way we see marriage.

title: Miracle Cures
summary: A son tries to help his mom in a faraway place defy the laws of medical science.

summary: Letting someone else take care of you can change everything.

summary: Stories about people deciding whether to give it their all.

summary: Behind enemy lines, sometimes people get confused about whose side they're on and how to fight the enemy.

summary: It's rare that a successful apology happens.

summary: Lotto fever grips the cast of Riverdance.

summary: Stories about the kinds of chase games that just never end.

summary: Is Guantanamo Bay a camp full of terrorists, or a camp full of our mistakes?

summary: Stories about people trying to find new solutions to age-old problems.

summary: Stories of proxy fights, proxy arguments, and proxy situations of all kinds.

summary: Stories recorded during our 2007 live tour, by Sarah Vowell, David Rakoff, Dan Savage, and others.

summary: Stories of people trying to recover from damage to their reputations.

summary: Is Guantanamo Bay a camp full of terrorists, or a camp full of our mistakes?

summary: What happens to the people left behind after the detectives close the case?

summary: Stories of the unintended consequences of market forces.

summary: We go into the writers' room at The Onion, where they start with over 600 potential headlines for their fake-news newspaper each week.

summary: Stories about people who take the law into their own hands.

summary: Stories about people who take grand, sweeping approaches to solving problems of all sorts.

summary: Stories about people trying to find new solutions to age-old problems.

title: Ground Game

summary: A man in Pakistan buys an amulet with the power to protect anyone from harm. He tests it out on a chicken.

summary: We highlight the unusual circumstances our economic drought has left us in.

summary: Little-known and surprising stories of how all sorts of institutions began.

summary: It's tempting to act as your own lawyer, to argue your own cause.

summary: The U.S. government spent two years on a sting operation trapping an Indian man suspected of being an illegal arms dealer.

summary: Stories of people betting on something with very bad odds.

summary: Stories where the fine print changes everything, whether you read it or not.

summary: Stories about people who find themselves either unexpectedly being singled out or doing the singling out.

summary: Stories that pinpoint when people's boring old lives turn into something wildly unfamiliar.

summary: Stories from the awkward, confusing, hormonally charged world of middle school.

summary: Stories united by one thing: They all happened in the seven days prior to broadcast.

summary: It's the thought that counts. Unfortunately, sometimes it's not always so clear what that thought was.

title: Good Guys
summary: Stories of valiant men attempting to do good in challenging circumstances: in war zones, department stores, public buses, and at the bottom of a cave 900 feet underground.

title: Stuck In The Middle (2014)
summary: Stories about how it sucks to be in limbo, and a man who absolutely loves listening to hold music.

title: Day at the Beach (2014)
summary: David Sedaris tells us how losing a sister prompted a family reunion, and an impulse buy of an oceanfront cottage big enough for all of them.

title: Except For That One Thing
summary: A clerical error allowed a convicted man to walk free for 13 years. Then the justice system realized its mistake.

title: Dead Men Tell No Tales
summary: Last May, the FBI killed a guy in Florida who was loosely linked to the Boston Marathon bombings.

title: No Place Like Home
summary: Stories of people who are coming to terms with the places they call home.

title: Bad Baby
summary: They're small. And they're cuddly. But sometimes it feels as though our babies were replaced with demon replicas.

title: Tarred and Feathered
summary: A pedophile who has never acted on his impulses starts an online support group to help himself and others like him.

title: Death and Taxes
summary: We ask the people who work at a hospice facility some personal questions about death and dying.

title: I Was So High
summary: Alex Blumberg talks to his dad about the daily pot habit he had while Alex was growing up.

title: Call For Help
summary: Stories of people coming to terms with being in serious trouble.

title: Is That What I Look Like? (2014)
summary: A woman wakes up from a coma having forgotten that she'd divorced her husband. And Molly Ringwald watches The Breakfast Club with her daughter.

title: 180 Degrees
summary: Stories of people who go one way, and then, for what ever reason, turn around and go the exact opposite direction.

title: The Radio Drama Episode
summary: In our most ambitious live show, we turn journalism into a Broadway musical written by Lin-Manuel Miranda.

title: Human Spectacle 2014
summary: A Japanese reality show contestant has to enter sweepstakes from magazines to win enough sustenance to survive.

title: Mind Your Own Business
summary: A cellphone hidden in a bag of chips starts a messy turf war between the FBI and a local sheriff.

title: Got Your Back
summary: Stories where one person's powerlessness is transformed when they discover they have backup. And what happens when that backup goes away.

title: Magic Words
summary: Stories where people recite words that have the power to change their lives.

title: It's Not the Product, It's the Person
summary: Alex Blumberg tells the incredible, sweat-stains-and-all saga of a man fumbling through starting a new business. And the man is: himself.

title: A Not-So-Simple Majority
summary: School board disputes are pretty common, but not like this one.

title: Origin Story
summary: Little-known and surprising stories of how all sorts of institutions began.

title: The Secret Recordings of Carmen Segarra
summary: An unprecedented look inside one of the most powerful, secretive institutions in the country.

title: The Alibi
summary: The pilot episode of Serial, hosted by Sarah Koenig.

title: Is This Working?
summary: There's no agreement about how teachers should discipline students. And there's evidence that some of the most popular punishments may harm kids.

title: The Leap
summary: When routines get too mundane, sometimes you just have to hold your breath and jump.

title: A Front
summary: If a Border Patrol agent is not actually at the border, do you have to obey him?

title: Regrets, I've Had a Few
summary: People struggling with regrets—big and small—that take root and have to be dealt with.

title: Wait—Do You Have The Map?
summary: Two brothers take a doomed road trip through Mexico. Plus other stories of feeling lost and trying to figure out how to move ahead.

title: Wake Up Now
summary: The story of a company—or maybe it's a movement?—that has hundreds of people posting enthusiastic videos about it online.

title: Batman
summary: Can people’s expectations change whether a blind man can see?

title: If You Don’t Have Anything Nice to Say, SAY IT IN ALL CAPS
summary: What happens when the internet turns on you?

title: Burroughs 101
summary: Ira Glass was never into William Burroughs. Then he heard this radio story that changed that.

title: Cops See It Differently - Part One
summary: There's a division between people who distrust the police and people who see cops as a force for good.

title: Cops See It Differently - Part Two
summary: We look at one city where relations between police and black residents are terrible, and another city where they seem to be improving remarkably.

title: Amateur Hour
summary: A tough group of soldiers attempts to save lives through the power of show tunes.

title: Three Miles
summary: What happens when of a group of public school students in the Bronx goes to visit an elite private school three miles away.

title: Good Guys 2015
summary: Stories of valiant men attempting to do good: in department stores, public buses, and at the bottom of a cave.

title: Need To Know Basis
summary: Growing up, Stephanie Foo was the favorite child of her family in Malaysia. As an adult, she found out the complicated truth about why.

title: Stuck in the Middle
summary: People caught in limbo, using ingenuity and guile to try to get themselves out.

title: Not It!
summary: A mysterious world of heroin addiction treatment centers where no one seems to be taking responsibility for the people they're treating.

title: The Incredible Rarity of Changing Your Mind
summary: Stories of those very infrequent instances where people’s opinions flip on fundamental things that they believe.

title: Same Bed, Different Dreams
summary: A movie star and her ex-husband plot against Kim Jong-Il, plus more stories of people who are tied together but imagine radically different futures.

title: Birds & Bees
summary: Stories about the vague and not-so-vague ways we teach children about race, death, and sex.

title: Game Face
summary: Stories of people facing very difficult situations who put their game face on and muscle through.

title: Captain's Log
summary: The story of a concentration camp in China that housed groups of Girl Scouts.

title: Abdi and the Golden Ticket
summary: A story about someone who's desperately trying – against long odds – to make it to the United States and become an American.

title: NUMMI (2015)
summary: A car plant in Fremont California that might have saved the U.S. car industry.

title: The Problem We All Live With - Part One
summary: There’s one thing that has been proven to cut the achievement gap between black and white students by half: integration.

title: The Problem We All Live With - Part Two
summary: A city goes all out to integrate its schools.

title: Too Soon?
summary: It can be hard to know the right moment for something to happen.

title: Lower 9 + 10
summary: We go to the Lower 9th Ward in New Orleans to talk to residents about what matters most to them ten years after the hurricane.

title: The Land of Make Believe
summary: A father constructs an elaborate fantasy to occupy his 12 children.

title: What’s Going On In There?
summary: Getting inside a situation and finding out just how interesting it is.

title: Human Spectacle
summary: We've always loved to gawk at others, but what's it like when the tables are turned and all eyes are on you?

title: Put a Bow on It
summary: Meet the people who pitch ideas for new foods and then decide which ones they're actually going to make.

title: The Night in Question
summary: Conspiracy theories about the assassination of Yitzhak Rabin continue to shape Israel's politics and future.

title: The Heart Wants What It Wants
summary: Emily Dickinson said “The heart wants what it wants.” This week, stories from people who take that notion to extremes and are unapologetic about it.

title: Transformers
summary: A prisoner who hasn't talked to anyone in years comes up with a bold plan to re-introduce himself to the world.

title: Status Update
summary: Three teenage girls explain why they are constantly telling their friends they are beautiful on Instagram. Plus more stories about status updates that interrupt our daily life.

title: Sinatra’s 100th Birthday
summary: Stories, tributes, and attempts to understand the Chairman of the Board.

title: Poetry of Propaganda
summary: Propaganda is complexity in the form of simplicity, if you know how to read it.

title: Say Yes To Christmas
summary: We go all in and bring the joy, the spontaneity, the sense that anything can happen back to Christmas.

title: Something Only I Can See
summary: A woman with muscular dystrophy tries to convince doctors that she has the same gene mutation as an Olympic athlete.

title: I Thought I Knew You
summary: A conservative radio host is completely baffled by the candidate his audience has decided to get behind this election season.

title: My Damn Mind
summary: A hospital staffer finds a patient on the floor of his room. He is unarmed, and has been shot by the cops in the hospital.

title: That's One Way to Do It
summary: The story of a young voter who defies political categorization.

title: Anatomy of Doubt
summary: The story of a rape investigation gone undeniably wrong.

title: When the Beasts Come Marching In
summary: The animals drop in and show us who's boss.

title: It’ll Make Sense When You’re Older
summary: Kids do not like being told it’ll make sense when they’re older. They’re pretty sure the grown-ups are wrong.

title: For Your Reconsideration
summary: The older and wiser we get, the more bewildering our past decisions can seem.

title: In Defense of Ignorance
summary: Three very different stories of people not admitting the truth.

title: Who Do We Think We Are?
summary: When Mariya Karimjee was little, her family made a decision that would affect her entire life. Years later, she wants to know why.

title: The Perils of Intimacy
summary: Mysteries that exist in relationships we thought couldn't possibly surprise us.

title: Mind Games
summary: People who try simple mind games on others and find themselves in way over their heads.

title: Tell Me I’m Fat
summary: Maybe it’s time to rethink the way we see being fat.

title: Choosing Wrong
summary: Stories of people making the wrong choice, even though the right one is staring them squarely in the eye.

title: Get Your Money's Worth
summary: A political donor has to decide whether or not he's going to support Trump. Plus other stories of people trying to make sure they get what they paid for.

title: Are We There Yet?
summary: 57,000 refugees are stuck in Greece, making homes in some surprising locations.

title: Don’t Have to Live Like a Refugee
summary: Stories of refugees in Greece trying to move on with their lives in whatever way they can.

title: My Summer Self
summary: Summer is a time when change seems more possible than ever. But is that really how it happens?

title: Deep End of the Pool
summary: What do you do when you're thrown into a situation you’re not prepared for?

title: Becoming a Badger
summary: Stories about people trying their best to turn themselves into something else—like a badger.

title: One Last Thing Before I Go (2016)
summary: Ordinary people make last ditch efforts to get through to their loved ones.

title: My Undesirable Talent
summary: San Francisco’s Spider-Man dropped into buildings from skylights and leapt 10 feet from one roof to another. But mostly, his talent got him into trouble.

title: Seriously?
summary: Watching lies become the truth in the 2016 election.

title: Will I Know Anyone at This Party?
summary: Right now a lot of Republicans feel like they don’t recognize their own party.

title: Master of Her Domain… Name
summary: A story about Hillary Clinton that offers a different picture than what we’ve been hearing from both sides during the campaign.

title: The Sun Comes Up
summary: People around the country talking about the coming four years after Trump's election.

title: Once More, With Feeling
summary: Stories of people who decide to rethink the way they’ve been doing things.

title: 20 Years Later
summary: Samantha Broun interviews her mom about surviving a brutal attack 20 years ago that ended up changing Pennsylvania law regarding life sentences.

title: Kid Logic
summary: Kids using perfectly logical arguments, and arriving at perfectly wrong conclusions.

title: Just What I Wanted
summary: Stories from people who want something desperately and then have their wishes fulfilled. Or do they?

title: Didn’t We Solve This One?
summary: Why has it been so hard for us to get the tens of thousands of Iraqis and Afghans that have helped the U.S. to safety?

title: The Revolution Starts At Noon
summary: Some people are super-stoked for the political changes that are coming.

title: It’s Working Out Very Nicely
summary: We document what happened when the President’s executive order went into effect temporarily banning travel from seven countries.

title: Grand Gesture
summary: People going to very extreme measures to demonstrate their feelings.

title: Vague and Confused
summary: A show about rules and what happens when they’re vague and randomly enforced.

title: Ask a Grown-Up
summary: Teenage girls ask for advice about their love lives, and Ira's tribute to his very grown-up friend Mary.

title: OK, I’ll Do It
summary: A surgeon takes out his own appendix in what might be one of the most daring surgeries ever performed.

title: The Other Mr. President (2017)
summary: What it's actually like to live in the confusing information landscape that is Putin's Russia.

title: The Beginning of Now
summary: Before Trump started his presidential campaign, there was a congressional race that redefined what was possible in American politics.

title: I Am Not a Pirate
summary: Stories about both historical and modern-day swashbucklers who loot, pillage, and question their choices.

title: Fermi’s Paradox
summary: Three people grapple with the question, “Are we alone?”

title: Mr. Lie Detector
summary: A polygraph operator and his strange journey.

title: The Magic Show
summary: Former kid magicians Ira Glass and David Kestenbaum dive back into the world of magic.

title: To Be Real
summary: People try to go deeper—to get to something real—in some unexpected places: war, magic, and porn.

title: Fear and Loathing in Homer and Rockville
summary: Two towns grapple with the question—who do we let in?

title: Who You Gonna Call?
summary: Stories of lucky people who have found the exact right person to ring up for help.

title: We Are in the Future (2017)
summary: Afrofuturism is a way of looking at black culture that’s fantastic, creative, and oddly hopeful.

title: Private Geography
summary: What Betsy DeVos's experience in a public school in her hometown can tell us about her vision for education in this country.

title: Essay B
summary: In 1967, the first Black students integrated the South’s elite prep schools. One of the main reasons they were there? To benefit the white kids.

title: White Haze
summary: What should we make of right-wing groups like the Proud Boys, who believe “the West is the best”?

title: Suitable for Children (2017)
summary: Neil Drumming looks back at a toy he loved that, in retrospect, probably wouldn’t love him back.

title: In the Shadow of the City
summary: Stories that take place on the edge of civilization, just out of sight.

title: Expect Delays
summary: Stories about delays, including a town in Ohio known almost entirely for its speed trap.

title: Things I Mean to Know
summary: Stories of people trying to unspool some of life’s certainties.

title: So a Monkey and a Horse Walk Into a Bar
summary: Blurring the line between animal and human.

title: Somewhere Out There
summary: Of the billions of people in the world, what are the odds that any two people are a real match?
